reviewText: Over the years, I have watched many movies and read many books (to include the Bible) on end time's prophecy. I feel that this DVD goes against some of what I have found to be biblically accurate. It is well put together and well produced, but all portions are not in-line with the bible. I believe there are some inaccuracies. Watch this production with caution and use your Bible to verify the information it gives you.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Nowhere on the DVD case or on the DVD itself does it identify this as being Seventh Day Adventist material. I suppose if you are familiar with Pastor Doug Batchelor, which I wasn't, you might be able to figure it out. The material presented in this video is so far removed from my Protestant beliefs as to be unrecognizable. I cannot recommend this DVD. I would instead recommend viewing the work of Dave Hunt or Chuck Missler.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was very pleased with the purchase, and the movie: The Final Events of Bible Prophecy.  I had already seen it on Pastor Batchelor's T.V. ministry program.  I am very glad to have it in my dvd collection.  I plan to share it with my friends and family!I was also very pleased with the condition and the time it took to get to me.  Thank you very much!
summary: My review of the dvd I purchased.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I viewed this on the heels of it's predecessor, COSMIC CONFLICT: THE ORIGIN OF EVIL(Doug Batchelor), and as was the case with COSMIC CONFLICT, I was impressed by the outstanding production, the biblical insight, the presentation of Doug Batchelor, and the SDA angle on the culmination of all things(aka end of the age, end of days,etc), but some of what was covered, again, seemed to pull as much from SDA interpretations of scripture as they did from scripture itself(and I don't mean that in a bad way, but I've heard/read OTHER SDA angles that contrast this particular angle a bit). For instance, while angles agree where the "catching away" is concerned, they contrast where judgment is concerned(ie, the production suggests that those "outside the gate" will be faced with their own sins and all be unrepented and thus condemned, while I've heard other perspectives suggest that they'll be given space to repent when the Spirit and the Bride say 'Come.') But overall, another very insightful piece from SDA and a worthy investment for those who enjoy studies of the word.
summary: Outstanding Production, But One of Several SDA Angles...

reviewText: Not much discussion of Israel in the documentary and it's depiction of the antichrist is a little different than what I believe.  I don't expect him to be walking around in robes looking like Jesus as the documentary seems to imply.
summary: Not the best Prophecy DVD I have ever watched

reviewText: 2011/05/27I gave this video a low rating because it teaches "annihilism" as many of the cults teach. (Although I do not believe that the organization behind this video is a cult, there are some former teachings, that if still adhered to, are cultic in nature - "annihilism" being one of them.)For this reason, I would advise against the purchase of this DVD.If you do decide to purchase it, I would suggest using extreme caution and only acquire it if you have a firm Biblical foundation in order to be able to recognize the errors it contains.If I had known of this particular teaching, I would have steered clear of this DVD and I would not have purchased it.NOTE:  There are many good sources available for research into this topic, so I won't get into the debate here.
Title: N/A
